title: PAWNSHOP / SAWED-OFF STREET LIGHT
description: You look at and ask Roy about a street light.

dialogueTree.title: Sawed-off Street Light: "It's the 700 reál modified street l..."
dialogueTree.text: It's the 700 reál modified street light you traded for shares.

links.title: You: "Read the sign."
links.text: Read the sign.

links.title: Sawed-off Street Light: "It reads: 'SOLD TO THE DISCO COP FO..."
links.text: It reads: 'SOLD TO THE DISCO COP FOR SHARES IN M-K MERCURY GROUP.' The words are written with an even kerning in bold, precise letters.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Looks surprisingly official for a s..."
links.text: Looks surprisingly official for a small-time trader. Some of your big-biz flair must be rubbing off on him.

links.title: You: "Look at the light in your life."
links.text: Look at the light in your life.

links.title: Sawed-off Street Light: "The pole has been carefully cut, th..."
links.text: The pole has been carefully cut, the wiring redone and attached to a standard indoor plug. The light buzzes faintly but persistently.

links.title: Inland Empire: "She's going to *love* it."
links.text: She's going to *love* it.

links.title: You: "Who is?"
links.text: Who is?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Silence..."
links.text: Silence...

links.title: You: "(Don't ask.)"
links.text: (Don't ask.)

links.title: Inland Empire: "Silence..."
links.text: Silence...

links.title: You: ""I've got big plans for this light...."
links.text: "I've got big plans for this light. Your shop's gonna be a landmark one day."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Hm?" He surfaces from a daydream...."
links.text: "Hm?" He surfaces from a daydream. "Oh, right. That's... good," he replies, unsure of what you said.

links.title: Sawed-off Street Light: "Your eyes slide back to the 700 reá..."
links.text: Your eyes slide back to the 700 reál modified street light you traded for shares. The golden light seems to flicker ever so slightly, like a butterfly... It casts shadows on the sign.

links.title: You: "See you later, sunshine. [Leave.]"
links.text: See you later, sunshine. [Leave.]

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Uh," comes a voice from behind the..."
links.text: "Uh," comes a voice from behind the glass. "One quick question. How do I get hold of my shares?"

links.title: You: ""I'll get my Personal Brand Strateg..."
links.text: "I'll get my Personal Brand Strategist to sort the legal work out with you." (Mumble.) "Once I have one..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Oh, right. Perfect. Thank you.""
links.text: "Oh, right. Perfect. Thank you."

dialogueTree.title: Sawed-off Street Light: "It's the 700 reál modified street l..."
dialogueTree.text: It's the 700 reál modified street light you bought for some unknown reason.

links.title: You: "Look at the light in your life."
links.text: Look at the light in your life.

links.title: Sawed-off Street Light: "Still the same. The pole has been c..."
links.text: Still the same. The pole has been carefully cut, the wiring redone and attached to a standard indoor plug. The light buzzes faintly but persistently.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Makes you feel *rebellious*."
links.text: Makes you feel *rebellious*.

links.title: You: ""Is there still no way you'd give m..."
links.text: "Is there still no way you'd give me my money back? I can't do anything with this light."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I'm sorry, there are no returns or..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, there are no returns or exchanges for items purchased in this shop. Just enjoy it."

links.title: You: "Great. I guess I'm stuck with it. [..."
links.text: Great. I guess I'm stuck with it. [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Sawed-off Street Light: "A typical Martinaise street light s..."
dialogueTree.text: A typical Martinaise street light sits among assorted floor and table lamps.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Street lights like this one were pa..."
links.text: Street lights like this one were part of a renovation effort a few decades back. Sadly, the effort was abandoned before it was completed -- and so these lights still illuminate crumbling streets.

links.title: You: "Let your gaze run over the street l..."
links.text: Let your gaze run over the street light.

links.title: Sawed-off Street Light: "The light pole has been carefully c..."
links.text: The light pole has been carefully cut, and the wiring has been redone and attached to a standard indoor plug. The light buzzes faintly but persistently.

links.title: Conceptualization: "This would make quite a statement i..."
links.text: This would make quite a statement in your living room.

links.title: You: ""Is that a street light?""
links.text: "Is that a street light?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes, officer. As you can see, it's..."
links.text: "Yes, officer. As you can see, it's in perfect working order."

links.title: Composure: "His manner is casual, but his speec..."
links.text: His manner is casual, but his speech is careful, measured. He wants you to know that he has nothing to hide.

links.title: You: ""Where did you get this?""
links.text: "Where did you get this?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It was brought to me to be altered.""
links.text: "It was brought to me to be altered."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We're not here to investigate the..."
links.text: "We're not here to investigate the theft of city property." He leans in so the pawnbroker doesn't hear him.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You have to admit, it's rather cle..."
links.text: "You have to admit, it's rather clever, what he's done with it." He pauses, studying the light.

links.title: Sawed-off Street Light: "The light's buzzing resembles the p..."
links.text: The light's buzzing resembles the purring of a cat. It seems very much at home here.

links.title: You: ""Let's talk about this trade then,..."
links.text: "Let's talk about this trade then, if you're happy with shares?" (Start hustling.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""More than happy. Like I said, I va..."
links.text: "More than happy. Like I said, I value the street light at 700 reál. You decide how many of your shares that gets me."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "As *little* as possible. We only se..."
links.text: As *little* as possible. We only sell shares if we're getting something of *more value* for them. Shares are *premium* goods. THINK BIG BUSINESS!

links.title: Endurance: "He has an idea of what he wants but..."
links.text: He has an idea of what he wants but he's not giving it away. Sign of a veteran dealer -- able to withstand negotiations over minuscule amounts for *days* or even *weeks*.

links.title: Logic: "A twentieth of your shares is a sen..."
links.text: A twentieth of your shares is a sensible offer. Very divisible as far as numbers go.

links.title: Empathy: "Some extra shares would go a long w..."
links.text: Some extra shares would go a long way to helping him out of debt. He deserves a break.

links.title: Empathy: "Something lifted in him when he saw..."
links.text: Something lifted in him when he saw those shares. He *needs* as many as possible -- even if he won't admit it.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""More than happy. I value the stree..."
links.text: "More than happy. I value the street light at 700 reál. You decide how many of your shares that gets me."

links.title: You: ""Let's talk about trading those sha..."
links.text: "Let's talk about trading those shares again."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes please," he says eagerly."
links.text: "Yes please," he says eagerly.

links.title: You: ""I'll give you a third of my shares..."
links.text: "I'll give you a third of my shares for it."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A *third*? Are you sure?""
links.text: "A *third*? Are you sure?"

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Whoa, whoa, whoa! What are you doin..."
links.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa! What are you doing? That street light isn't worth anywhere near that much. Reel it in, moneybags. Or do you like being bankrupt?

links.title: You: ""Yes, I'm sure.""
links.text: "Yes, I'm sure."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Alright, you have a deal. The stre..."
links.text: "Alright, you have a deal. The street light is all yours." His shoulders relax as if a load has been lifted off them. "Pleasure doing business with you."

links.title: You: ""How does it feel to be a *sharehol..."
links.text: "How does it feel to be a *shareholder*?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yeah, good. But I won't be holding..."
links.text: "Yeah, good. But I won't be holding onto these shares for long." He gives you a false grin. "I've got to pay those debts off."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yeah, good. But I won't be holding..."
links.text: "Yeah, good. But I won't be holding onto these shares for long." He gives you a false grin.

links.title: You: ""Got some big purchases planned, ha..."
links.text: "Got some big purchases planned, have you?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Let's just say there's some long o..."
links.text: "Let's just say there's some long overdue business I've got to deal with."

links.title: You: ""Nothing like a good business deal..."
links.text: "Nothing like a good business deal to loosen the joints, is there?" (Rotate your shoulders.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He doesn't quite catch your meaning..."
links.text: He doesn't quite catch your meaning. "Oh... sure." He tries to mimic your rotational action but just ends up shrugging.

links.title: You: ""So how do I get this light out of..."
links.text: "So how do I get this light out of here?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It is quite heavy. You're going to..."
links.text: "It is quite heavy. You're going to need a truck."

links.title: You: ""But... I don't have a truck.""
links.text: "But... I don't have a truck."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""That's alright, I can keep it here..."
links.text: "That's alright, I can keep it here for you until you find one."

links.title: You: ""How can I trust that you won't sel..."
links.text: "How can I trust that you won't sell it to someone else?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Tell you what..." He bends down an..."
links.text: "Tell you what..." He bends down and disappears behind the counter.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Did he just do a runner? He can't g..."
links.text: Did he just do a runner? He can't get away that easily. Try calling out to him.

links.title: Half Light: "What if he's grabbing a GUN?!"
links.text: What if he's grabbing a GUN?!

links.title: Volition: "Don't panic. I'm sure he's just doi..."
links.text: Don't panic. I'm sure he's just doing his shoelaces up. Something like that.

links.title: You: "(Ready your hands on your pistol.)"
links.text: (Ready your hands on your pistol.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant catches your movemen..."
links.text: The lieutenant catches your movements and meets your eyes with a look of confusion.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "You tense up as the pawnshop owner..."
links.text: You tense up as the pawnshop owner uprights himself back into view. There isn't a gun in his hands -- or anywhere else on him. Instead, he holds out a piece of cardboard. "Here we go."

links.title: Half Light: "He's trying to cut you with its sha..."
links.text: He's trying to cut you with its sharp edge!

links.title: Volition: "He's *really* not. Just take it off..."
links.text: He's *really* not. Just take it off him.

links.title: You: ""Careful where you point that thing..."
links.text: "Careful where you point that thing. It's sharp!"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I assure you it's not." He runs a..."
links.text: "I assure you it's not." He runs a finger along its edge. "See? Not a scratch. Now, please, take it and stick it on the street light. That way people will know it's *yours*."

links.title: You: ""Phew." (Relax.) "I thought you wer..."
links.text: "Phew." (Relax.) "I thought you were grabbing a gun."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Oh, nothing like that." He is comp..."
links.text: "Oh, nothing like that." He is completely unfazed by your statement. "Just this sign that declares you the owner of the street light. Stick it on and people will know that it's *yours*."

links.title: You: "(Search for something you can defen..."
links.text: (Search for something you can defend yourself with.)

links.title: You: ""Hey! Where'd you go?""
links.text: "Hey! Where'd you go?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "The pawnshop owner uprights himself..."
links.text: The pawnshop owner uprights himself back into view with the stiffness of an old ironing board. "Here we go," he says, holding a piece of cardboard out at you.

links.title: You: ""What's that?""
links.text: "What's that?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It's a sign that declares you the..."
links.text: "It's a sign that declares you the owner of the street light. Stick it on and people will know that it's *yours*."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Great idea! One of your physical as..."
links.text: Great idea! One of your physical assets *on display* for the public. Maybe this was a good idea after all. We could sell tickets for people to come see it, turn this into a little money churner...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "But let's come back to that idea la..."
links.text: But let's come back to that idea later. There's easier money to be made elsewhere. Just get that sign stuck on there for now.

links.title: You: ""I like your thinking.""
links.text: "I like your thinking."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He watches you attach the sign to t..."
links.text: He watches you attach the sign to the street light using the sticky tack he put on the back of it. "There you go. Beautiful job."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He hands you the sign then watches..."
links.text: He hands you the sign then watches you attach it to the street light using the sticky tack he put on the back. "There you go. Beautiful job."

links.title: You: ""It'll have to do for now.""
links.text: "It'll have to do for now."

links.title: You: "(Take it.)"
links.text: (Take it.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He hands you the cardboard and you..."
links.text: He hands you the cardboard and you notice there's something written on it. "Stick this to the light and people will know that it's *yours*."

links.title: You: "(Pretend to browse the shop from wh..."
links.text: (Pretend to browse the shop from where you're stood.)

links.title: You: ""I want my shares back then.""
links.text: "I want my shares back then."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""But... why? It's a perfectly wonde..."
links.text: "But... why? It's a perfectly wonderful light. Besides," he points to the sign on his booth, "there are no returns or exchanges for items purchased in this shop."

links.title: You: ""Actually, no.""
links.text: "Actually, no."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Take your time.""
links.text: "Take your time."

links.title: You: ""How does a twentieth sound to you?""
links.text: "How does a twentieth sound to you?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Hm, that's a reasonable offer." He..."
links.text: "Hm, that's a reasonable offer." He raises a curled finger to his chin, looking as thoughtful as he can.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "This is all for show. He's already..."
links.text: This is all for show. He's already made his mind up.

links.title: Drama: "The pose! The power! Yessssss, drag..."
links.text: The pose! The power! Yessssss, drag this part out and reel in your audience, darling. See if they will crack under the suspense.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Alright, you have a deal. The stre..."
links.text: "Alright, you have a deal. The street light is all yours." His shoulders relax as if a load has been lifted off them. "Pleasure doing business with you."

links.title: You: ""I can't go higher than a few share..."
links.text: "I can't go higher than a few shares."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He gulps. "That's... not enough.""
links.text: He gulps. "That's... not enough."

links.title: You: ""Look, I was told that these shares..."
links.text: "Look, I was told that these shares will *double* in value in five years' time."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""But I want to sell them *now*." He..."
links.text: "But I want to sell them *now*." He tilts his head slightly to consider this new information.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Or has another light shining on the..."
links.text: Or has another light shining on the ceiling caught his eye? It's hard to tell.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Alright, alright. That'll have to..."
links.text: "Alright, alright. That'll have to do." His shoulders relax slightly. "The street light is all yours."

links.title: You: ""Take it or leave it. Makes no odds..."
links.text: "Take it or leave it. Makes no odds to me."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Forget it, then. I'll get more for..."
links.text: "Forget it, then. I'll get more for the light in cash. Unless you want to reconsider?"

links.title: You: ""I need time to mull this over." (G..."
links.text: "I need time to mull this over." (Go back.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Of course, officer." There's a tin..."
links.text: "Of course, officer." There's a tiny hint of distress in his voice. "It's your decision."

links.title: You: ""How much for the street light?""
links.text: "How much for the street light?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Seven hundred reál. A bargain, I d..."
links.text: "Seven hundred reál. A bargain, I dare say."

links.title: Half Light: "A bargain?! No, it's not! He's tryi..."
links.text: A bargain?! No, it's not! He's trying to sweet-talk you into buying trash!

links.title: You: ""Are you out of your mind? There's..."
links.text: "Are you out of your mind? There's one just like that on every corner!"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The light has undergone three tran..."
links.text: "The light has undergone three transformations, and every transformation, large or small, has a price tag." He rests his elbows on the counter and brings his face closer to the glass.

links.title: Logic: "The light has been removed and rewi..."
links.text: The light has been removed and rewired -- that's two *transformations*. But what about the third?

links.title: You: ""I get how sawing it off and redoin..."
links.text: "I get how sawing it off and redoing the wiring could add to the cost, but what else?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The most important transformation..."
links.text: "The most important transformation is the light's placement among ordinary *indoor* fixtures, which has adjusted its morphological field. The light became suitable for use inside the home just a few days ago." He throws you a look of weary patience.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Okay. That checks out."
links.text: Okay. That checks out.

links.title: You: ""What do you mean, *transformations..."
links.text: "What do you mean, *transformations*?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Well, there are the costs of remov..."
links.text: "Well, there are the costs of removal and rewiring." He throws you a look of weary patience.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""But the most important transformat..."
links.text: "But the most important transformation is the light's placement among ordinary *indoor* fixtures, which has adjusted its morphological field. The light became suitable for use inside the home just a few days ago."

links.title: You: ""Even taking into account the risk..."
links.text: "Even taking into account the risk of obtaining the light, that seems a bit steep...."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""There's also the matter of rewirin..."
links.text: "There's also the matter of rewiring. But the most important transformation is the light's placement among ordinary *indoor* fixtures, which has adjusted its morphological field. The light became suitable for use inside the home just a few days ago."

links.title: You: ""Seven hundred sounds about right...."
links.text: "Seven hundred sounds about right. I imagine it wasn't easy sawing off that street lamp."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Hey, I don't know where it came fr..."
links.text: "Hey, I don't know where it came from, but it's not every day you get to buy and sell something so extraordinary..."

links.title: You: ""I want that street light. Here's 7..."
links.text: "I want that street light. Here's 700."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Excellent choice. I'm almost sad t..."
links.text: "Excellent choice. I'm almost sad to part with it."

links.title: You: ""But how am I going to take it with..."
links.text: "But how am I going to take it with me?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It is quite heavy. You're going to..."
links.text: "It is quite heavy. You're going to need a truck."

links.title: You: ""But... I don't have a truck.""
links.text: "But... I don't have a truck."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""That's alright, I can keep it here..."
links.text: "That's alright, I can keep it here for you until you find one."

links.title: You: ""Thanks, I appreciate it.""
links.text: "Thanks, I appreciate it."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It's no problem. Come back any tim..."
links.text: "It's no problem. Come back any time to look at it. It's *your* sawed off street light now."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A wise investment. I agree. The be..."
links.text: "A wise investment. I agree. The best part is that you *can't* carry it around -- I would really dislike it if you could."

links.title: You: "Leave your street light be for now...."
links.text: Leave your street light be for now. [Leave.]

links.title: You: ""I want my money back.""
links.text: "I want my money back."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""But... why? It's a perfectly wonde..."
links.text: "But... why? It's a perfectly wonderful light."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Besides," he points to the sign on..."
links.text: "Besides," he points to the sign on his booth, "there are no returns or exchanges for items purchased in this shop."

links.title: You: "There's nothing else you need to kn..."
links.text: There's nothing else you need to know about the light. [Leave.]
